ARABIC: قَالَ إِنَّمَآ أَشْكُوا۟ بَثِّى وَحُزْنِىٓ إِلَى ٱللَّهِ وَأَعْلَمُ مِنَ ٱللَّهِ مَا لَا تَعْلَمُونَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: He said, 'I make complaint about my grief and sorrow to Allah alone because I know things from Allah you do not know.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: He replied: "I cry my plaint and grief to God, and know from God what you do not know.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: He said: "I will address my sorrow and grief only to Allah, and I know from Allah what you do not know.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: He replied, "I only complain of my sorrow and grief to God. I know about God what you do not know.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: He said, “I complain of my worry and grief only to Allah, and I know the great traits of Allah which you do not know.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: He said: "I only complain of my grief and sorrow to Allah, and I know from Allah that which you know not."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: He said: I only complain of my grief and sorrow to Allah, and I know from Allah what you do not know.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: He said, 'I make complaint of my anguish and my sorrow unto God; I know from God that you know not.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: He said: I expose my distress and anguish only unto Allah, and I know from Allah that which ye know not.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: He said "I only complain of my anguish and my sorrow to God. God has made known to me things that you do not know.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: He said: I only bewail my cogitation and grief unto Allah, and I know from Allah that which ye know not.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: He said, ‘I complain of my anguish and grief only to Allah. I know from Allah what you do not know.’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: He said: "I only complain of my distraction and anguish to Allah, and I know from Allah that which ye know not...
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: He said: "I only complain of my grief and sorrow to Allah, and I know from Allah that which you know not.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: He replied: 'I complain to Allah of my anguish and sadness. I know from Allah what you do not know.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: He said, “I only complain of my grief and sorrow to God, and I know from God what you do not know.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: He said, "I only complain of my suffering and my grief to Allah, and I know from Allah that which you do not know.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [12:86] He said, to them: ‘I complain of my anguish — (bathth is) severe grief, which cannot be endured unless it is proclaimed [yubaththu] to others — and grief only to God, not to any other than Him, for it is worth complaining to Him; and I know from God what you do not know, [and that is] that Joseph’s dream is true and that he is alive. Then he said:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: 253 (He said) Jacob said: (I expose my distress and anguish only unto Allah, and I know from Allah that which ye know not) I know that Joseph's vision is true and that we will prostrate to him; it is also said that this means: I know of Allah's mercy and of His good work that which you do not; it is also said that this means: I know that Joseph is alive. That is because the angel of death came to him and he asked him: "did you take away the soul of Joseph from among those you took their souls away". And the angel said he did not.
